name: Cognia (formerly AdvancED)
description: Cognia is a global nonprofit organization that accredits primary and secondary schools, school systems, and education service providers. Cognia accreditation indicates that a school meets rigorous research-based standards, engages in continuous improvement, and has demonstrated quality in its educational programs. For families of children with autism, choosing a Cognia-accredited school provides assurance of institutional quality and accountability.
recognition: Cognia is recognized worldwide and accepted by colleges, universities, and employers as a mark of educational quality. It is one of the largest accreditation agencies in the world.
benefits: Widely accepted by colleges and universities
requirements: Demonstrate a commitment to continuous improvement
Engage in regular self-assessment and external review
Provide evidence of student learning and growth
